channel.title: [PI]Pk Point Exchange[PI]
channel.description: How would I go about making a item so when you click on it, it gives you Pk Points? I know it's in clickitem.java I just don't know the code since I'm not a java coder.

The modelID yes.

That would be why…
The modelID points to a model in your raw (or models) folder or your cache. Each model is named .dat.gz (usually) or similar. the modelID would then be

item.title: [PI]Pk Point Exchange[PI]
item.dc:creator: @SenorMasacre SenorMasacre
item.description:
@SenorMasacre wrote:

No I mean for itemDef.java

I have this:

	case 15287:
		itemDef.actions = new String[5];
		itemDef.actions[0] = "Rip";
		itemDef.name = "100 Pk Points Slip"; //Name
		itemDef.description = "If ripped, 100 Pk Points will be added to your account. ".getBytes(); //Description
		itemDef.modelID = 3683;
		itemDef.modelZoom = 3840;
		itemDef.modelRotation1 = 108;
		itemDef.modelRotation2 = 1684;
		itemDef.modelOffset1 = 15;
		itemDef.modelOffset2 = -126;
		break;

but when I have it coded like that, it’s just a box. It’s not what is was before I added that in. How do I put it back so it’s not a box but a check?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Pk Point Exchange[PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Terraforming, post:7, topic:537144”]Thanks, didn’t know it was an int.

The reason I made the boolean is for the person won’t spam click the item and get + 10 pk points everytime, but I didn’t include the saving.[/quote]
that’s why you check if they actually ‘have’ the item. Because that way this issue isn’t encountered and you don’t need to add another boolean.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Pk Point Exchange[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Terraforming Terraforming
item.description:
@Terraforming wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:6, topic:537144”][quote author=Terraforming link=topic=655954.msg4391127#msg4391127 date=1387565463]


public int woreItem = false;

case 4151://Item Id
      if(player.woreItem) {
           player.getPackets(),getChatPacket().sendGameMessage("You already wore this item which you get no pk points!");
           return;
      }
      player.woreItem = true;
      player.getPlayerDetails().pkPoints += 10;
      player.getInventory().deleteItem(4151, 1);
      player.getPackets().getChatPacket().sendGameMessage("You wore the "+player.getInventory().getItemName(4151)+" and receive 10 pk points.");
}

This is very basic and ugly but this should help you get an idea.

Good luck
[/quote]

This doesn’t make any sense and you shouldn’t get to complex for just adding pk points to your player. I don’t understand why you have a boolean if they wore the item when you can just delete the item from the character.

Thanks, didn’t know it was an int.

The reason I made the boolean is for the person won’t spam click the item and get + 10 pk points everytime, but I didn’t include the saving.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Pk Point Exchange[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“Terraforming, post:5, topic:537144”][code=java]

public int woreItem = false;

case 4151://Item Id
if(player.woreItem) {
player.getPackets(),getChatPacket().sendGameMessage(“You already wore this item which you get no pk points!”);
return;
}
player.woreItem = true;
player.getPlayerDetails().pkPoints += 10;
player.getInventory().deleteItem(4151, 1);
player.getPackets().getChatPacket().sendGameMessage(“You wore the “+player.getInventory().getItemName(4151)+” and receive 10 pk points.”);
}
[/code]

This is very basic and ugly but this should help you get an idea.

Good luck :)[/quote]

This doesn’t make any sense and you shouldn’t get to complex for just adding pk points to your player. I don’t understand why you have a boolean if they wore the item when you can just delete the item from the character.

public int woreItem = false; You have to make this a boolean.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Pk Point Exchange[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Terraforming Terraforming
item.description:
@Terraforming wrote:


public boolean woreItem = false;

case 4151://Item Id
      if(player.woreItem) {
           player.getPackets(),getChatPacket().sendGameMessage("You already wore this item which you get no pk points!");
           return;
      }
      player.woreItem = true;
      player.getPlayerDetails().pkPoints += 10;
      player.getInventory().deleteItem(4151, 1);
      player.getPackets().getChatPacket().sendGameMessage("You wore the "+player.getInventory().getItemName(4151)+" and receive 10 pk points.");
}

This is very basic and ugly but this should help you get an idea.

Good luck

Read full topic

c.sendMessage(“You touch the ancient artifact and receive 10 pkPoints!”);
pkPoints += 10;

@Dan0194 wrote:

case 5000: // the item id pkPoints += 10; deleteItem(5000, 1); c.sM("You have just recieved 10 Pk points!"); break;
That is just an example there may be some flaws.

btw you need to create a variable named pkPoints for it too work.

item.title: [PI]Pk Point Exchange[PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

It actually could be done where the equipping is done, since usually the first option is to wield but it doesn’t always get done there, since some items don’t automatically wield when you click it.

but basically it’d be

if(itemID == 1111){//Assuming the variable is "itemID" c.pkPoints += 10;//Assuming you want to give 10 and the variable is pkPoints. c.sendMessage("You touch the "+c.getItems().getItemName(1111)+" and receive 10 points");//getItemName is wrong but there's a method similar in ItemAssistant.java c.getItems().deleteItem(1111, 1);//To remove the item as you don't want them to have it any more. c.saveCharacter = true;//Change this to what ever saves your players. This is purely optional. }

Or if your click item uses cases you can do that.
Tip: It’s java programmer, not java coder. ‘coder’ wasn’t really a term for people that wrote code until recently, and it sounds more professional to say programmer than coder.

Read full topic
